reviews.review_msg: No Comments
worst prof ever, even harder than CMPT307

Very smart and explains things well in lecture.  Assignments are somewhat easy, but deceptive. Explain everything, and I mean EVERY LITTLE THING you could possibly imagine.  It should take longer than the assignment itself.  Tests are hard, but scaled.  He's really into the details, as you'll see in his solutions.
He is a good teacher and explains things well. He goes into a LOT of detail. His assignments aren't too bad but the midterm and final are quite tough. Be prepared if you are planning to take him!

Good prof.  Assignments, exams are fair.  The course itself seemed to be 371 all over again with maybe 30% new stuff.  I'd like to have some more focus on security (penetration and defense) of the protocol stack.

pretty easy and he makes the content somewhat interesting. 
 but somehow he went against his grading scheme and might give a higher final grade to a student with a lower final mark than another.

I was happy with Mr. Haffer.  He may seem hard because he expects you to do some self-learning with the extra references he gives you but this is something you should be greatful for. Class averages may be low but final grades are curved.
simply worst ever! Never ever take his class! cant believe that I already have taken it!
hard, hard, too hard. And he cares nothing~ Why someboday says "Very Easy"?
PUNK face , style, hehehe
Class is a joke.  Very easy but you don't come out learning anything new.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Utterly incompetent. Uses slides made years ago filled with mistakes and outdated information. Sometimes she gets confused about what is written in her own slides. Every assignment and exam she gives you will be filled with errors; she doesn't proofread anything. Exams are twice as long as they should be. Lectures are best for sleeping or skipping.
A lot of work, which basically is a lot of writing.

The assignments are for 1-3 people but it seems like you will hardly do it if you are alone and you need to find group members. Janice will not consider if it is fair or not do the assignment alone or not. It is really weird that the quizzes and exam to be like a writing course. Many people dropped this course during the first two weeks.

Avoid this prof. Her assignments are brutal and extremely long, most of the time you spend on the assignment is learning how to do things completely unrelated to the class. She is does not change questions on quizzes, assignments, and exams so half the class is cheating by memorizing past material. Bad group policy for assignments. AVOID.

Dropped this class during the third week.  The first assignment, a lab working with an echo server, did not seem to work.  I really couldn't tell if the equipment--csil lab vml--actually worked.  Tried several times, with three different computers, but no progress.   I really didn't like the idea of going through 5 more labs. Small class;  beware.

decent prof, one few that actually records lectures. I only attended class when there was a quiz otherwise, listened to online lectures. quizes are easy and she gives out alot of bonus marks. Assignments: long and painful, but she has bonus questions and early bonus submission marks. The course itself is long and complicated with alot of info
Weekly quiz, biweekly assignments means there's ALOT of work in this course. However, this means tons of opportunities for marks. Be sure to study past quiz/MT/finals to prepare!

So picky in meaningless rules. She insisted in using C instead of C++ in CMPT471, which is ridiculous. You can hardly learn anything from her class except what you learn from reading the slides yourself. Her course even has one quiz for each class! I can't persuade myself she is a instructor of computer science.

AVOID! Weekly long ans quiz random (study wrong area and interfere with hwk), possibly last 2 classes (not 1 as promised), not covered by 1hr review (distracting to cram before break), 2004-5 samples irrelevant. Notes don't flow well to remember process, talk fast to cover 32 slides! Lecture not helpful for hwk, DIY UNIX socket lib and shell script

she's the worst of all time. Making us to do assignment 1 which extend to the deadline of assignment 3 and still we need to hand in assignment 2 3 on time. She's trying to make us learn so much but she doesn't give a working instruction. if someone is able to learn all that, it's self-learn not she taught us.

The first assignment is quite heavy but do not get scared by it. This is the biggest by far of all of the assignments.This is a great class as long as you want to learn about internet protocols and you should attend most classes if you can! Beware of the length of her notes.Try to study early for the final otherwise you will have to read 500 pages

Well, I dont like her much before but this course really changed me. She's a nice lecturer who enjoy teaching. When I got a question, she just offers her sincerest help! Even thought I didn't do good on her final and midterm, she makes this course pretty easy to follow and i did learn alot! Thanks!

The instructor has a slight accent, but hey we live in multi culture society, all matters is how good he is. Indeed, he is extremely good at explaining the concept, and those details you will remember forever. Midterm and finals are quite reasonable. Highly recommend him and do NOT skip his lecture. Reading book is optional, all mats is in lectures
Didnt really learn much from 471.  Assignments were easy and on the same level as 371. Lectures are almost not worth going to as slides cover everything.
He is dull and sometimes hard to understand but all assignments and exams are based off notes and homework. As long as you keep up with those you will get a great mark in his course.
Notes are crystal clear. Exams are straightforward. Extremely helpful and approachable.
No Comments
very good prof...
very nice prof. well organized and work load is fine

Nice, good organization, high interest to the coures make him such a high-rating prof. Willing to listen and very helpful on assignment. The class's overall average was 82%! Although he offers this course once per year, believe me, take his 471.

I don't know why people don't like her. I think she's nice and helpful. She even had bonus point for pointing out her mistakes in slides and she will reply to every one of them. 471 was better than 371 though, there were interactive sessions added, where you can analyze real network traffic and exams were also worth 35% instead of 40%.
For a first time professor, he delivered lectures well, was very lenient and accommodating to students, and was extremely accessible to questions students had.
Organized lectures, very lenient to student requests such as extensions or extra credit. Gives bonus marks. Great prof and easy course.
great

I think the topics are interesting and practical. Labs are alright but projects are a bit underwhelming. Usually only takes low single digit hours to finish. 2 exams and no final. If you want a light UD course this will work.

The prof will make you will fall in love with how the IT industry has evolved over the years. How it took 50 years to build the protocols that are in use today. What problems each iteration of these protocols solved. How the networks are set up in the industry today. How does money impact the optimality of internet. Hands down awesome prof.

This professor is a good professor, he explains concepts very clear in lecture. Very helpful professor with enough office hours, and very responsive (quick reply to emails). The exams are fair, as long as you study his lecture note thoughtfully, you can get a good score in exams.
